15: Relationships in the Pastoral Family
 

Home
 

     The real character of the minister is revealed at home.--It is not so much the religion of the pulpit as the religion of the family that reveals our real character. The minister's wife, his children, and those who are employed as helpers in his family are best qualified to judge of his piety. A good man will be a blessing to his household. Wife, children, and helpers will all be the better for his religion.--AH 354.
